okay. first update of the year, guys.

looking back on 2005, there are a few things that stick out to me. my dad's accident, my family issues, my amazing friends, my relationship with carter, an amazing summer, my hospital incident, and the start of one of the hardest school years of my life. even though some of those things really sucked, they've all helped me to grow and mature and become a better person.

dad's accident: taught me to value every moment with my family and friends, because you never know when that will be taken away from you. he was so close to dying, and that scares me, and its has definately taught me to appreciate every moment spent with him-and everyone else.
family issues: yeah, those really suck. the fighting, the stress, and all that jazz. its pretty terrible. but, it's helped me to speak my mind, and tell them the truth about how i feel about everything, which is something i never had the courage to do before.
amazing friends: wow. you guys kept me strong throughout this rough year. i wanna thank EVERYBODY who was there for me through this year. you all mean the world to me. and yeah, i've lost a copule really good friends, and gained a couple more. i miss the old ones, but love the new ones.

summer: freaking rocked. and thats all i have to say about that.
my hospital incident: definately taught me not to overload myself and try too hard to make everyone happy. also taught me that some people are gonna talk crap about you,even though its totally not true. even though it was like, the scariest thing thats ever happened to me, it still had some positive influences, right?
and this school year: has wiped.me.out. but hey, its definately preparing me for college, right? and believe it or not, senior year is just around the corner.

its really hard to believe that today is the one year anniversary of my dad's accident. one year ago today, life at the jones' changed forever. 

one year ago today, i was sitting in the hair place with sara, getting my hair cut, when my phone rings and my mom says we have to go to the hospital, cause my dad fell and broke his wrist. i wasn't too worried about it; he had broken things before, and from all indications, we didn't think it was serious. so we drive to st. paul, and finally find him, and begin to realize how serious things really were. he was lying on a backboard, strapped down, with a neck brace on. they had an ace bandage on it with a splint to keep it in place, and took it off to take x-rays, and it was so bad i passed out. literally out cold on the floor. then they come in and tell us he broke his hip too, and they'd have to transfer him to parkland because they weren't equipped for the stuff that needed to be done. and thus began the ten days at parkland, the surgeries, and the therapy that have continued on to today, one year later. and things haven't gotten any better, they've only gotten worse. 

its just really hard to believe that one year ago today, i was just a normal 15 year old teenaged girl, sitting in the hair place, getting a haircut, talking to my best friend, dreading practice the next day,  and thinking about the new years party i was going to have that weekend and hoping i would get to talk to carter that day. its just hard to believe that so much has happened in a year.
